    • Constructor Detail

      • ClickRepeaterConfig

    • Method Detail

      • setAccelerate

        public void setAccelerate(boolean accelerate)
        True if autorepeating should start slowly and accelerate. "interval" and "delay" are ignored. "immediate" is honored.
        Parameters:
        accelerate - true to start slowly and accelerate

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(int delay)
        The initial delay before the repeating event begins firing. Similar to an autorepeat key delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - delay in milliseconds. Default is 250

      • setElement

        public void setElement(com.google.gwt.user.client.Element element)
        The element to act as a button.
        Parameters:
        element - the element

      • setElement

        public void setElement(java.lang.String elementID)
        The element to act as a button.
        Parameters:
        elementID - the element ID

      • setInterval

        public void setInterval(int interval)
        The interval between firings of the "click" event. Default is 10 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        interval - the firing interval

      • setPressClass

        public void setPressClass(java.lang.String pressClass)
        A CSS class name to be applied to the element while pressed.
        Parameters:
        pressClass - the press CSS class

      • setPreventDefault

        public void setPreventDefault(boolean preventDefault)
        True to prevent the default click event. Default is true.
        Parameters:
        preventDefault - true to prevent default click

      • setStopDefault

        public void setStopDefault(boolean stopDefault)
        True to stop the default click event. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        stopDefault - true to stop default click event
